entry.title: Adjustments
entry.summary:
Author: gingerandcinnamon07

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,844Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 35

Summary: After a mission helping Constantine goes awry, you and Jason now have to navigate him being bitten by a werewolf (yes) and all the small, or large, adjustments that come with that. While Constantine works to find a reversal ‚Äî after all, he got you all into this mess and portal-hopping-lycanthropes weren‚Äôt in the mission briefing ‚Äî the two of you try to just take it all business as usual. Course that‚Äôs pretty difficult when there‚Äôs a whole family of bats getting in the way, Jason starts getting growly, and you‚Äôre fairly certain that this is all some weird fever dream. What could go wrong?

entry.title: How to Get a Ghoul-friend
entry.summary:
Author: Pipon

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,310Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 86

Summary: Jason is doing his thing, cleaning up Gotham's underworld one piece of shit at a time. After he takes out someone who'd been breaking his rules and evading him for years, something bad happens, and more things keep happening that he can't explain. Things he swears are all connected, somehow, and they all point... to her. He notices his family worrying, but they don't take his "findings" seriously. Admittedly theres no... concrete proof and the woman he claims to be communicating with has been missing for years, and if Jason wasn't experiencing all of this first hand he might not believe it either... Was he going crazy? He really hopes he's not going crazy... Again.---You are an unholy undead creature who has found herself haunting none other than the fearsome Red Hood, but only because you don't really have a choice in the matter. You do your best to look out for Jason's best interests from the shadows, but its hard when you're terrified of how he'd react to the mere sight of you. Probably best to stay hidden for now... What's the worst that could happen?(Really self indulgent, not to be taken too seriously, im playing fast and loose with canon events and magic and all that shit)

entry.title: Follow The Leader
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,575Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 74

Summary: You were no hero nor vigilante, but you played your own role, assisting those who lived on the streets just like yourself. You would occasionally take on a dirty job of some description, whether that was a drug run, a stint in a brothel, whatever it took to get your hands on money. Then, you‚Äôd take your cut, disappear a while, and go around Gotham offering food, water, warm blankets, and other necessities to those who needed them. Children, adults, dirty, clean, old, young, didn‚Äôt matter to you. If they needed help, they got it. When some thugs come for revenge for a drug run gone wrong, you are saved by the Red Hood. But, as you are a criminal yourself, you are terrified of what he might do to you. He wants to show you he has no intention to hurt you.

entry.title: Until We Are Whole Again
entry.summary:
Author: Wr1ting_adict

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,884Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 2

Summary: He's a violent storm disguised as a man; she's a drowning creature disguised as a woman. Neither of them feel whole- and they believe they never will be. Drawn together by pure coincidence, a glance became a conversation, a conversation became a confession, a confession became a promise. She teaches him gentleness; he teaches her courage. She teaches him that chaos is harmful; he teaches her that silence is too. Slowly, their cracked souls start to heal. However, healing is never simple ‚Äì nor always permanent. Some cracks refuse to close. Some scars refuse to heal. Some even continue to ache after they've been mended. Still, in the ruins of who they used to be; something tender began to bloom- a love forged from brokenness, from the fragile situation of being seen, from the scary miracle of being understood. And for the first time, they dare to ask themselves the same question- What if we're not meant to be whole alone?
